title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer defends Ed Woodward over key decision at Man Utd
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is happy with the structure at Manchester United (Getty Images)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer insists he supports the structure that Ed Woodward has put in place at Manchester United.

Woodward has been heavily criticised for United’s approach to the transfer market in recent years which has left Solskjaer needing to strengthen several key areas of the squad.

United were also considering the idea of hiring a director of football to help improve the club’s transfer strategy.

But Solskjaer is adamant that he has enough control to decide United’s future and the signings they make.

‘All the talks I’ve had with the owners, with Ed Woodward and the club have been about me having a three-year contract,’ Solskjaer told Sky Sports.

Solskjaer insists a recruitment plan is in place at United (Getty Images)

‘We’re planning long-term. I’ve been given the job and if you lose a game or two, you don’t wait for a call to be given assurances.

‘But we started out with a plan and a recruitment plan is in place.

‘I’m 100 per cent sure from my time here that the structure is right because it is always the manager who has the final say.

‘Myself and Mick [Mike Phelan] are the ones who make the decisions on the players that we want to have.

‘It’s then up to the scouts and whether the players are available before the negotiations.’
